data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: Moments after entering the system, you receive a message from the nearby ship; "We are sinners! Oh woe is us! Strike us down! Punish us! We do not deserve the gift of life!"
Ask them why they're upset.
Strike them down.
Ignore them.
The Rockman's pleading continues for some time, but you simply tune them out and fly away.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: "I have SINNED! I... used the restroom... and I was out of toilet paper... and I had a holy script nearby and... OH GOD! I'm a MONSTER! How could you make me relive my crimes? You are cruel! Too cruel for this world! First I will kill you, then myself!"
계속...

"I have SINNED! I... used the restroom... and I was out of toilet paper... and I had a holy script nearby and... OH GOD! I'm a MONSTER! Oh please, allow me to redeem myself! In any way I can, perhaps there are favors I can serve to find my way to heaven once more!"
"I have changed my mind! I no longer wish to die! I shall redeem myself by killing you instead!"
계속...
"Oh thank you good captain! Only in death shall I find redemption!"
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: A stoic Rock Captain hails you. "Federation. I have an important question for you. Why can you not expect perfection from geologists?"
Uh... We don't know.
"Because they all have their FAULTS!" He breaks into intense laughter.
Laugh in return.
Your laughter mixes together with the Rockman. After a while, you both calm down. So grateful that you found humor in his pun, the Rockman feels compelled to gift you some missiles!
End their pitiful existence.
"Wait... Wait no, it was just a joke!"
계속...
(Zoltan Crew) "What a shocker!"
The Rockman is so impressed by the retaliation of your own pun that he submits, promising to dedicate the rest of his existence to your servitude. As long as he can keep making puns along the way.
(Crystal Crew) "Ahh, a wise crack!"
The Rockman is so impressed by the retaliation of your own pun that he submits, promising to dedicate the rest of his existence to your servitude. As long as he can keep making puns along the way.
(Leech Crew) "That joke sucks."
"Is that supposed to be a pun? I cannot tell if you are insulting me or making a pitiful attempt to join me. I hate Leeches. Get out of my sight!"
계속...
(Slug Crew) Have your Slug predict the answer.

Your Slug grumbles. "It'ssss jussst a ssstupid pun." Your Slug repeats the answer to the Rockmen. "Because they all have faultssss..." The Rockman frowns that you predicted it, and turns off transmissions.
A nearby Rock settlement, painted almost entirely light blue, hails you. "You are from the outside? You wouldn't happen to have anything originating from the Crystal race, would you?"
(Crystalline Weapon) We have a Crystal weapon.
"Amazing! Such a well crafted weapon too. I don't suppose you'd be willing to sell us one, would you?"
Sell them a Crystal Burst MK I.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them an Elite Crystal Burst MK I.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them a Crystal Burst MK II.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them an Elite Crystal Burst MK II.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them a Heavy Crystal MK I.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them an Elite Heavy Crystal MK I.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them a Heavy Crystal MK II.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them an Elite Heavy Crystal MK II.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them a Crystal Scatter.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them an Elite Crystal Scatter.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them a Crystal Charger.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them an Elite Crystal Charger.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them a Neural Crystal.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them an Elite Neural Crystal.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them a Lockdown Bomb.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them a Shard Launcher.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
Sell them an Amber Launcher.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
We aren't interested in selling anything.
"Ah... what a shame. Oh well, you must know that you are very lucky to wield such exotic tech!"
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
(Crystal Armor) We have Crystalline armor on our ship.
"Amazing! Such well crafted armor. I don't suppose you'd be willing to sell it to us?"
Sell them the armor.
"Thank you so much! We will use this to decorate our shrine!"
We aren't interested in selling anything.
"Ah... what a shame. Oh well, you must know that you are very lucky to wield such exotic tech!"
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
(Crystal Crew) We have a Crystal aboard our ship.
The Rockman goes silent. Then, in a shaky tone, he says, "You... you must be gods! Please, take everything we have!"
We don't, sorry.
The settlement immediately cuts transmissions.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/textLis: You encounter a Rock vessel and attempt to open trading frequencies, but they take it as an act of cultural transgression and open fire.
You jump into the middle of a Rock excavation project on a nearby moon. Unimpressed with your intrusion they move to defend themselves!
You intercept chatter from an approaching Rock ship: "Weapons, moving in to engage, arm the tubes." There is no talking to these guys.
As you jump in, a vast figure appears on the view-screen. The Rock captain rubs the green, moss-like appendage on his chin and then orders his crew to open fire.

It looks quiet, but you realize your computer is being scanned. A hidden Rock vessel hails you: "Why do you fill your computer with lies?! These are not the holy words!" Before you can interject they open fire.
You notice a Rock ship performing combat exercises. However, they quickly change their course to engage your ship. They apparently treat unregistered alien ships as handy target practice.
A loud 'thud' resounds through the ship after jump completion - you've just shunted a Rock fighter and he's already preparing to fire!
You're intercepted by a Rock salvage operation. They don't seem to mind that you're still on board while they junk your ship.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: 계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/textLis: A Rock mining vessel is harvesting the mineral-rich asteroids in this locality, and their scouts take your presence to be a transgression. Battle stations!
A rookie Rock cargo ship has taken its orders too literally and took the most direct route to their destination... right through an asteroid field. They're confused and fire wildly as you jump in.

The captain of a Rock freighter lost in the asteroid field hails you: "Our co-ordinates led us here, but only death greets us. What must be must be. Death to all." You power up the battle systems and wonder how long they've been stuck here.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: 계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/textLis: You arrive in an asteroid field and immediately begin evasive maneuvers when a loud clunk reverberates through the ship. At first you think the hull has been hit, but the noise came from some Rock intruders teleporting aboard the ship!

Your shields are being taxed as they deflect the debris from an asteroid field. As you weave your way between the rocks, you happen upon a Rock pirate stronghold. You register teleport signatures and hear shouts aboard the ship.
As soon as you arrive you hear the telltale sounds of a teleporter and shouts reverberating through the ship, "Prepare to burn, fleshy meat-sack aliens!"
With their high resistance to heat, outlaw Rocks often settle very close to stars. That is why it is hardly surprising when your ship gets boarded as you stumble past a hidden settlement.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: You're hailed by a Rock vessel, who is supposedly low on missiles. They offer to buy some from you.
Sell 5 missiles.
Sell 10 missiles.
Sell 15 missiles.
We aren't interested in selling anything.
You apologize and continue on your way.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
"Hah! Look at your wee little ship! I bet your weapons are tiny! You must be so ashamed."
The hell did you just say to us?
The Rockman arrogantly chuckles as you prepare to fight them.
계속...
(Lvl 2 Weapons) You'd be surprised.
"Hah! You call that big weapons? Your brain must be even smaller!"
(Lvl 4 Weapons) What about this?
"Getting warmer, but that's still nothing compared to what we have!"
(Lvl 6 Weapons) How about this!
"Hmmm, not bad. Not many ships come here packing such heat. I'm sure a ship like yours will find a use for a powerful weapon like this!"
(Lvl 8 Weapons) Oh, we can do better than that.
"Well now you're just showing off. I like it. I wish to sample your arsenal. I shall join you!"
계속...
Fine, you win.
Fine, you win.
(Lvl 1 Artillery) You'd be surprised.
"Hah! You call that big weapons? Your brain must be even smaller!"
(Lvl 2 Artillery) What about this?
"Getting warmer, but that's still nothing compared to what we have!"
(Lvl 3 Artillery) How about this!
"Hmmm, not bad. Not many ships come here packing such heat. I'm sure a ship like yours will find a use for a powerful weapon like this!"
(Lvl 4 Artillery) Oh, we can do better than that.
"Well now you're just showing off. I like it. I wish to sample your arsenal. I shall join you!"
계속...
Fine, you win.
Fine, you win.
(Pre-Igniter) How about this!
"Well now you're just showing off. I like it. I wish to sample your arsenal. I shall join you!"
Ignore them.
You ignore the egotistical Rockmen and continue on your way.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

"Jeez man, we've heard it's not about the size but how you use it, and you sure know how to use your guns! You've proven your point, let us go and we'll pay you some ammunition to fuel those guns of yours."
Accept their surrender.
Screw you!
You find a disabled Rock transport floating near the beacon. You consider stripping it of useful parts but are uncertain why it's there in the first place.
Strip the ship.
Leave it alone.
(Slug Crew) Check for lifeforms and keep a lookout for ships while looting the wreck.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: You salvage what you can from the ship. No one bothers you during the operation.
A Rock patrol ship jumps in while you are salvaging the ship. They message you, "Filthy pirates! Prepare to die!" You doubt explaining your mission will convince them of your need.
계속...
The Rock people are not known for setting traps but you hasten to leave anyway.
The Rock people are not known for setting traps but you hasten to leave anyway.

Before you have a chance to leave, a Rock patrol ship arrives and you intercept their comm chatter, "...appears we've finally found them. Their killing spree ends now!" Before you can plead your innocence they move in to attack.
계속...
You salvage what you can from the ship. No lifeforms or ships are detected nearby.
You begin the salvage operation but before long your crew warns you of an approaching ship. You hasten to leave before they get within firing range.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: A Mantis ship here is adorned with Rock body parts! It would be a gorier display if they had internal organs, but the message is clear enough: this is a hunter of a very specialized kind.
Attack!
No species deserves a Mantis hunter on their back - time to make the galaxy a little safer. Engage!
계속...
Ignore them.
The Mantis take no interest in your ship - they're lying in wait for the next Rock ship to venture through. You're able to spin up the engines and jump at your leisure.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
(Hull Armor) Ram the bastards.

Before they have a chance, you ram your ship into theirs, causing irreparable damage to their engines. Luckily, your ship's armored hull is hardly dented from the impact. The Mantis ship careens away and you move in to attack.
계속...
(Rock Crew) Put your Rock crewmember on the comm.
The two aliens face one another over the vidscreen. "Cave-dwelling pebble-man!" yells the furious Mantis captain. "See, I paint ship with your companions! I paint ship with you!"
계속...
A curious sight greets you at this beacon: a disabled Rock freighter drifts in space while two Mantis craft battle it out - presumably over who deserves the spoils.
Wait, then attack the surviving Mantis.
Ignore them.
There's quite enough action here already - prepare for light speed.
(Repair Drone) Repair the Rock ship.

While the two Mantis fight you approach the Rock ship and send a repair drone through one of the many breaches. It fixes the ship up enough to make at least a single jump. You're surprised when, instead, they embark on a kamikaze run on the two Mantis, which results in the obliteration of all three!
(Hull Repair Drone) Repair their hull.

While the two Mantis fight you approach the Rock ship and use a drone to fix up the ship. Once the breaches are fixed the life support flickers back on. In a matter of moments they are already in pursuit of one of the Mantis ships. Meanwhile the second Mantis turns toward you.
계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: The Mantis craft are both too busy slaughtering one another to notice you. Eventually the smaller ship gets the upper hand, but they must have blown a fuse in the assault and their weapons system is inoperable. Now is the time to attack!
계속...

The Mantis craft may have their differences, but when it comes to you they are of one mind. The smaller ship suffers a power failure as it moves to engage, but the larger one lets off a volley of fire and moves in to attack!
계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: It seems a Zoltan ship came here to liberate a Rock settlement from their 'oppressive belief system', and that the settlement did not appreciate it - long-range scanners suggest the Zoltan and their pursuers will be here at any moment!
Stay and defend the Zoltan.

The... extreme nature of Rock faith is well-known; the Zoltan can hardly be blamed for trying to broaden their horizons. The pursuing Rock ship quickly assesses the situation and decides two captured alien ships are better than one.
계속...
Stay and capture the Zoltan.
This is Rock territory, and therefore Rock law - the Zoltan should have known better than to interfere. You'll have to disable their engines and piloting to ensure their safe capture.
계속...
Leave.
This is none of your concern - power up the jump drive!

You encounter a small craft with minimal propulsion; its Rock crew-member explains that the Rock home-world is run on lies and propaganda that keep the populace in check, and that they want no part of it.
Tell them their god sent them here to join your crew.
계속...
Promise to share with them the truths they've been denied.
(Improved Sensors) Show them to your data suite.
The Rock captain is impressed by the data you've collected and agrees to stay with you until they find their footing in the galaxy.
(Lost Sun Commando) Teach them the ways of the Lost Suns.
The Rock captain is surprised, as he had previously thought the Lost Suns were a band of radical terrorists. Assured your ship will keep no secrets from them, he joins your crew.
(Orchid Crew) Have your Orchid talk them into joining you.

The Orchids are not only a race trusted by the Rockmen, but their government is incredibly well known for its transparency. Soothed by your crew, the Orchid talks them into coming with you, promising it'll be a better life than that among the Elders' lies.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/textLis: They barely hear out your appeals before yelling, "These are the lies I sought to escape!" Looks like they're charging weapons!
They listen to your appeals and whisper, "Traitors to truth. You're no better than them!" Chaos ensues.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: Your promises gain their attention and they agree to serve with you, for a while.
They seem tempted by your offer, but decide they can't risk being lied to again. They close frequencies and jump away.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
They seem tempted by your offer, but decide they can't risk being lied to again. They close frequencies and jump away.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: The burnt out hull of a Rock Trapper drifts by. Behind the wreck drifts a live mine; an automated drone that drills into ships' hulls before exploding. However, it can't detect you from this range, and you wonder if it's even active. Still, it's risky...
Scrap the wreckage.
You pick apart the hull of the ship, and find some scrap, ammunition, and a Mine Launcher! However, before you can leave the mine activates, and begins to seek out your ship!
Attempt evasive maneuvers!
The ship's turning circle proves too wide and the mine bites down onto the hull. You can hear it now, chewing through the armor.
Send someone out there to defuse it.
(Missile Weapon) Attempt a controlled detonation using a missile.

After drawing straws, a crewmember goes out to fix a modified warhead to the mine. You detonate the missile in a way that dislodges the mine. It blows up shortly after. The ship takes some damage in the blasts, but you're still sailing.
(Beam Drone) Use a drone to cut away the mine with a precision beam.
Carefully guided from the bridge, your Beam Drone removes the mine's grappling arms and sends it drifting off into space, where you shoot at it until it detonates at a safe distance.
(Improved Engines) Reverse thrusters!
It stresses the inertial dampeners, but you reverse course and outrun the mine. You prepare to jump off.
(Armor Plating) Your armor will protect you.
The mine struggles to even burrow into your ship. Its drill eventually runs out of power and drifts away, now rendered harmless.
(Energy Shield) Your shield will protect you.
The mine is incapable of getting past your Energy Shield. It explodes without even touching your ship's hull.
(Defense Drone) Shoot down the mine.
Fortunately, your Defense Drone quickly locks onto the mine and shoots it down before it can connect to the ship.
Ignore the wreck.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: Your crewmember dons a space suit and exits the airlock. They make quick work of the basic device and return inside to relief all round. The mine makes good scrap pickings too.
Your crewmember dons a space suit and exits the airlock. When they open up the mine housing, though, they panic. The red wire or the blue?! 3... 2... 1...
Red!
Blue!
(Elite Crew) Send your elite to defuse the bomb.
Your Elite doesn't hesitate. They pull off a second panel in the back, and cut the newly revealed green wire. Miraculously, the bomb deactivates!
You open your eyes and everything is still where it was a moment ago. You did it!

The weapon detonates. Everything goes dark, the bridge illuminated by flames pouring from the hull, your bomb disposal volunteer spinning off toward a nearby sun. You put out the fires and prepare to move on.
Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them. Sheepish and apologetic, they rejoin the crew.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: It seems you've discovered the Crystalline Waystone, the device used to enter the Crystal Homeworlds. The beacon is shockingly empty, despite the boom in tourism that eventually lead to the exodus of the Crystal race back to the galactic scene.
Scrap it.
Leave it alone.
Better not risk it. The Rock people are unlikely to respond well to vandalism.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
(Crystal Crew) Have your Crystal crew activate the device again.
Are you certain you want to do this? You will immediately be taken to the Crystal Homeworlds.
Yes.
Nevermind.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: You break it apart and take it for scrap. No one will miss it.
As you start to break it apart a Rock military ship jumps nearby, "You think you can come into our sector and just steal whatever you please?! Prepare to die, vandals!"
계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: A ship carrying several robed Rockmen carrying holy books and candles hails you. "A time of change is coming! Have you heard the news? The prophecy, it shall be fulfilled!"
What prophecy?

"Have you not heard? The ship from a future much brighter than ours, who will bring about a great change! A gift from the high heavens, bestowed upon us mortal-bound men by the benevolent Crystal ones!"
Could we be the ship from the prophecy?

One of the Rockmen pull down their cloak and stare for a long time deep into your eyes. "I am no expert, but you have the look of a creature driven by a force beyond your control. Your will is bent by a being from the great beyond, manipulated for the simple sake of amusement. If you are not the one spoken of in the prophecy, then surely you are important regardless. Perhaps this may be of aid."
These people are crazy, let's leave.
Ignore them.
You have better things to than listen to the ravings of these religious loons.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
Nearby rests a Rockman temple dedicated to the Crystal race. A thick fog covers the planet and it's hard to see if there's anything protecting the shrine.
Raid the temple.
Ignore the temple.
You'd have to be insane to raid a Rockman temple in Rock territory.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: While attempting to rob the temple, you are stopped by a Rock vessel, who immediately attacks!
계속...
Inside the temple you find some supplies and a Crystal weapon.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: 계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/textLis: You catch chatter on the nearby Rock ship. In a hush tone, they speak of your ship and what vile sins must be committed aboard it. Eager to enact out the Elders' law, they power up weapons and attack!
The Rock citizens are perhaps some of the best armed civilians of any race. Unfortunately, that means just about every ship you encounter here is more than willing to engage you in a brawl.
You've stepped foot in the Rock Homeworlds, the highly valued sanctuary for the Rock people. It is no wonder that the irate citizens of this sector seek your destruction so eagerly.
"This one, he is not covered in stone! We shall cut off his head, and mount it to our wall as a trophy!" It doesn't seem the Rockmen here are willing to negotiate.
There is a very thin line between civilians and military in the Rock Homeworlds. It's hard to tell the origins of the ship here, but nevertheless they're hostile and looking for a fight.
Your very presence in this sector is a tremendous insult to Rock-kind. The Rockmen in the nearby system aren't pleased with your presence and decide to deal with you themselves.
Rockmen aren't particularly friendly, but you know you've made a real mistake coming here when the civilians near this beacon go out of their way to initiate combat with you.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: The Rockman Crusaders were once recruited to enact the Inquisition, a brutal invasion of other worlds deemed full of heretics and instate the 'wisdom' of the Elders. The Federation has since put an end to the Inquisition, but the Crusader rank has not yet been disbanded. Now, they patrol the homeworlds as Elites and protect them from outsiders, such as yourself.
계속...

A Lost Sun ship, seeking out Rock citizens to capture and take back to the Stronghold as prisoners, identifies your ship. "Traitorous coward! A Federation vessel, out here, giving aid to the Rock Elders' followers? You are scum! I will roast all of you alive with only the holiest of fire." They aren't exactly correct, but you doubt arguing will help.
계속...

Fluctuating life-signs are reported near the surface of a hazy, pock-marked moon in the vicinity. It seems this is a Rock nursery where the young are 'acclimatized' to their religion - only there's been some kind of coup and the students are running amok!
Transfer an away team to investigate.
Your away team reports combat between students and authorities - it seems some of the students were considered to have dissident personalities and were to be imprisoned pro-actively.
Order the away team to side with the students.
It's not long before the violence on the planet becomes a full-scale battle, your away team and their military-grade weaponry in the very center of it.
계속...
Order the away team to side with the authorities.
It's not long before the violence on the planet becomes a full-scale battle, your away team and their military-grade weaponry in the very center of it.
계속...
Leave.
As long as they're not shooting at the ship it's best to leave them be.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
(Improved Weapons) Fire a warning shot near to the commotion to announce your arrival.

You dispatch a barrage of weapons fire that crashes home into an unused quarry near to the installation. Weapons fire on the surface ceases for as long as it takes for the moon's defense force to be dispatched to your location!
계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: Things, in the end, do not go well. The enemy succeeds in flanking your team and they're forced to retreat to the ship.
계속...
The staff and authorities subdue the last of the renegade students; prison transport ships are already in orbit.
계속...

The fight goes poorly, and your team eventually finds itself out on the flank with a wounded Rock combatant in tow. They make a desperate push for the shuttle co-ordinates, but one falls. The survivor helps the injured Rock aboard.
Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them.
계속...
The staff and authorities subdue the last of the renegade students; prison transport ships are already in orbit.
계속...
Your team hunkers down in the main quad and succeeds in holding off the enemy combatants and claiming control of the institution!
계속...
The students secure the remaining staff and prepare to leave the solar system - there is only one path open to them now, that of the outlaw.
계속...

Your team comes under heavy fire. One is blinded by a flash bomb and staggers past the lip of a quarry and to their death far below; the other succeeds in joining with friendly forces and ultimately claims control of the institution!
Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them.
계속...
The students secure the remaining staff and prepare to leave the solar system - there is only one path open to them now, that of the outlaw.
계속...

As the battle proceeds the action moves away from your team's location. During the lull they're able to secure some abandoned weapons; by the time they're done the battle is largely over and they return to ship.
Things, in the end, do not go well. The enemy succeeds in flanking your team and they're forced to retreat to the ship.
계속...
The students secure the remaining staff and prepare to leave the solar system - there is only one path open to them now, that of the outlaw.
계속...

The fight goes poorly, and your team eventually finds itself out on the flank with a wounded Rock combatant in tow. They make a desperate push for the shuttle co-ordinates, but one falls. The survivor helps the injured Rock aboard.
Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them.
계속...
The students secure the remaining staff and prepare to leave the solar system - there is only one path open to them now, that of the outlaw.
계속...
Your team hunkers down in the main quad and succeeds in holding off the enemy combatants and claiming control of the institution!
계속...
The staff and authorities subdue the last of the renegade students; prison transport ships are already in orbit.
계속...

Your team comes under heavy fire. One is blinded by a flash bomb and staggers past the lip of a quarry and to their death far below; the other succeeds in joining with friendly forces and ultimately claims control of the institution!
Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them.
계속...
The staff and authorities subdue the last of the renegade students; prison transport ships are already in orbit.
계속...

As the battle proceeds the action moves away from your team's location. During the lull they're able to secure some abandoned weapons; by the time they're done the battle is largely over and they return to ship.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: In return for your support during the fight the survivors reward you with the funds set aside for prison transport. You leave before anyone changes their mind!
Fully aware that their victory was threatened by your arrival, the survivors immediately dispatch a ship to eliminate you!
계속...
On the surface of a nearby planet is a massive ravine. It all looks normal until you spot two Rock scouts flying past, deeper into the ravine.
Follow them.

You trail the ships from far behind, making sure they can't see you but never losing them. Not too long after you reach a fork in the ravine, and the ships split up. If you don't want the Rebel fleet catching up, you'll only have time to explore one of the paths.
Follow the ship to the left.

The ship stops at what looks like a giant facility built into the face of the ravine's sheer drop. With nowhere to hide, the Rockmen inevitably spot you and prepare to defend whatever the facility may be.
계속...
Follow the ship to the right.
The ship lands near a giant prison camp built on the floor of the ravine. It looks abandoned, but you don't have much time to investigate before the Rockmen spot your ship and attacks.
계속...
Nevermind, this is a bad idea.
Ignore the ships.
Those Rockmen could be doing anything down there, and it's none of your business.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
You've defeated the Rock vessel. You have some time to scrap the ship before investigating the facility.
계속...

The entrance to the structure leads you to a deprecated lobby. A barely functional elevator suggests there must be a back-up generator running, because this facility has long since been abandoned. There's several different options for floors to explore, but you'll only have time for one.
Explore the floor marked as "control."

A floor marked control in a Rock facility is sure to be an interesting experience. You head there, wary of the elevator. Inside is a no-longer functional Mind Control system and a giant screen overlooking what looks to be a giant prison camp on the other side of the ravine. You begin to think there's nothing of actual use in this room until you notice a combat augment in the corner, as well as some discarded fuel cells.
Explore the floor marked as "security."

The security floor has piqued your interest. You head there, wary of the elevator. Heavy blast doors protect the way in, but something has managed to bend them back far enough for you to squeeze by. Several monitors overlooks the other rooms of the facility, proving it to be completely empty of staff. Not much here is of value to a military ship, other than a Long-Ranged Scanners augmentation and some droneparts.
Explore the floor marked as "armory."

The armory seems like the obvious choice. You head there, wary of the elevator. Inside you find several racks of supplies and various weapons. With limited manpower, you take one of the weapons at random as well as a few missiles.
You've defeated the Rock vessel. You have some time to scrap the ship before investigating the camp.
계속...

The Rock prison camp appears to be primarily abandoned, but a lone camp fire that's still burning suggests there may still be some life left behind. You're proven correct when further exploration reveals a small band of prisoners of various races. They explain that the prisoners revolted and managed to kill off most of the Rock guards. The Rockmen retreated and the surviving prisoners starved to death. This small group are the only ones who remain. You don't have enough space on the ship to take them all with you, but you can probably bring one of them.
Bring one of the Rock prisoners.
The Rock bears the markings of an outcast, likely a fugitive from the Rock government who was recently captured. They don't speak much, but you can tell they're glad you've chosen to rescue them.
Bring one of the Human prisoners.

The human turns out to be a Rebel Engineer, captured by the Rockmen with the intent to be used as a hostage to bargain with the Rebels. Unfortunately for them, the Rebels had no interest in buying back the prisoner. They were locked into this camp. Despite being of Rebel origins, they are more than glad to come with you and leave behind this place.
Bring one of the Slug prisoners.

The Slug was a tourist captured by the Rockmen based purely on suspicion. Not wanting to admit to their mistake, they simply chose to lock the Slug away in this prison for the rest of eternity. They're vibrant with energy at the prospect of finally being free.

It appears complete chaos has broken out on the nearby Rock colony. It seems a large asteroid collided with the planet and caused extreme damage, and now hundreds of ships are swarming back and forth from the planet's surface.
Apprehend the pirate raiders.
You fly towards the planet's surface and engage a pirate ship currently firing on unarmed Rock civilians.
계속...
Try to rescue the civilians.
Try to salvage the wreckage.
This is chaos. We should leave.
You avoid the colony and the ships around it.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
The pirate vessel crashes down into the ground, but luckily the civilians are unharmed. No one protests as you salvage the wreckage of the pirate ship.
Contact the civilians.

Most of the Rockmen are too panicked and flee as you approach. A few of the more sensible individuals stop to hear you out. You offer to transport as many of them as you can carry, an offer which most of them refuse. One young Rockman however accepts, even going so far as to join your crew.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: Most of the Rockmen are too panicked and flee as you approach. A few of the more sensible individuals stop to hear you out. You offer to transport as many of them as you can carry, an offer which most of them refuse. One young Rockman however accepts, even going so far as to join your crew.
As you approach, a pirate ship locks onto you and fires a few shots across your hull. You're forced to pull away, but the pirates follow in pursuit!
계속...
The only place safe for you to land is near empty patch of land that was once a residential complex. Now reduced to rubble, you salvage what little hasn't already been taken.
The Rock Enforcers are too busy dealing with the pirates to notice you. You swoop in and collect as much as you can.
It seems one of the Elite rock vessels trying to fend off the pirates has noticed you. You're chased by the ship, and it seems a fight is unavoidable.
계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: A cluster of Inquisition ships are resting nearby, making minor repairs. They haven't noticed you.
Hail them.
"Federation ship, you are not welcome here! Do not contact us again, unless you have a death wish."
Contact them again.
"Gah! Now you've asked for it."
계속...
(Rock Crew) Have your Rockman contact them.

"One of us? Perhaps I was mistaken of your origins. We have encountered an unpredicted obstacle in our usual duties. A Mantis vessel, full of heretics and scum, has made the fatal mistake of entering our sector! Unfortunately, it seems we're not fully prepared for their boarding tactics. Are you able to fulfill our mission and destroy the Mantis?"
Agree to kill the Mantis.

The Inquisition ships give you the co-ordinates of the Mantis. To your surprise, they aren't far away, so close in fact that they inhabit the same beacon. Another unexpected turn is that they are no Hive Mantis ship, but rather Free Mantis! "Oh, Federation! Hello! We glad to see you. This sector weird, yes? Not long ago, we chased by big blue ship with angry stone man. Very scary."
Follow through with your promise and kill the Free Mantis.
You have a mission to follow through with. You arm your weapons and engage the Free Mantis.
계속...
We can't fight our allies.
The Rockmen are enraged at your betrayal. "This is an insult beyond anything I have ever experienced! You are weak, and must be punished."
계속...
We cannot.
"Then you are of no use to us. Leave at once."
Abide their warning and leave.
Ignore them.
You put some distance between you and the Rockmen, just to be safe.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
You've defeated the Free Mantis ship. You salvage the remains.
Confirm your success with the Inquisition.
"A worthy display of your honor and prowess. I applaud you. Accept this as a token of gratitude."
You've defeated the Rockmen. You salvage the remains.
Contact the Free Mantis.
"Scary stone man dead now? Wow... this sector very not friendly. I come with you now, and bring twin brother."
A ship without life forms within a nearby dense asteroid field is giving off the distress call. Shall we investigate? It could be dangerous.
Search for the ship.
Avoid the area.
Discretion is the better part of valor. Better not risk it.
(Rock Plating) Make a thorough search for the ship without fear of stray asteroids.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: You find what appears to be pieces of a derelict Crystal station. Before you have a chance to dock, a few asteroids get past your shields and partially damage your engines. You'll have to pull out!
You find a pirate ship, damaged and abandoned. You salvage what you can and move on.
You find the decaying remains of a derelict Crystalline station. There's a weird sense of deja vu, and in the corner is a stasis pod and a Crystal weapon.
계속...
It looks like a massive asteroid is in a direct collision course with the station! You have to pull your crew out but they want to grab what they can first. What do they take?
Take the weapon and any spare resources.
Your crew grabs what they can and returns to the ship before the asteroid hits. You take a look at what you've recovered once you move clear of the asteroid field.
Grab the stasis chamber.
Your crew drags the pod back to your ship before the asteroid smashes into the ship, shattering through the crystal coating and destroying the ship.
계속...

You're able to activate the stasis chamber once again and find the Crystal inside still alive. They're confused and wondering what year it is, so you give them a very simple explanation as to your current situation and hurry to leave the asteroid field.
You find the decaying remains of a derelict Crystalline station. There's a weird sense of deja vu, and in the corner is a stasis pod and a crystal weapon.
계속...
It looks like a massive asteroid is in a direct collision course with the station! You have to pull your crew out but they want to grab what they can first. What do they take?
Take the weapon and any spare resources.
Your crew grabs what they can and returns to the ship before the asteroid hits. You take a look at what you've recovered once you move clear of the asteroid field.
Grab the stasis chamber.
Your crew drags the pod back to your ship before the asteroid smashes into the ship, shattering through the crystal coating and destroying the ship.
계속...

You're able to activate the stasis chamber once again and find the Crystal inside still alive. They're confused and wondering what year it is, so you give them a very simple explanation as to your current situation and hurry to leave the asteroid field.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: You have encountered a refugee ship drifting in space. It looks as if it was fleeing the Rebel advance and ran out of fuel. Its distress beacon is active, but you're not sure anyone is on board.
Hail them.
Ignore the refugees.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: As you hail the refugee ship, a Rock ship suddenly jumps into the system... The Rockmen accuse you of protecting heretics and gives you no time to argue before it raises its weapons.
계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: A Rock captain hails you: "It is improper of me to contact off-worlders, but this is an emergency. We were on our way to deliver our passenger to her new husband - the Grand Basilisk of Numa V - when our engines broke down. Will you take possession of her and make haste to Numa V?"
Accept the passenger.
"You surprise me, off-worlder. Thank you. The passenger will be with you momentarily." She refuses to enter the main hold and prefers to wait in the cargo bay.
Refuse.
Arranged marriages aren't on your list of worthy causes. You leave the Rock to their business.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
A vast tunnel network near the surface of Numa V indicates an advanced Rock civilization. This must be where you were asked to deliver the passenger.
계속...

Realizing arrival is imminent, the passenger - silent so far - pleads with you not to hand her over. She's interrupted by the Grand Basilisk's Chief Aid: "To the alien vessel holding the Basilisk's wife. Deliver her to us. You will be rewarded... well."
Hand her over.
"May your children erode into dust!" she screams as she's bundled into the waiting shuttle. The Rock guards on board hurriedly drop off an exotic piece of technology and return to the Grand Basilisk.
Refuse to comply.
"I was led to believe your kind did not know mercy. I will join you. But quickly, we must jump away - they will not tolerate..." She's interrupted by weapons fire from the Basilisk's escort!
계속...
You are immediately messaged by an imposing looking Rock war vessel, "You're the ship off to 'save the Federation,' aren't you? And you expect to survive with that hunk of junk?"
"We're going to save them or die trying."
"The latter being more likely. Still... we can potentially help you and your precious fleet, but you'll need to prove yourself first. Meet us at these coordinates." They jump away.
"We're strong enough to destroy you!"
"One ship is not the same as a fleet, but at least you've got some fire. Meet us at these coordinates if you want to prove to us that the Federation is worth saving." They jump away.
Ignore them.
"Heh. Like I expected. If the Federation is as weak as you it deserves to fall." They jump away without another word.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

You arrive at the coordinates given and find yourself dangerously close to an M-class star! The other ship messages you, "Let's see how long your puny ship can handle this heat! Prepare for a challenge!"
You arrive at a massive Rockman shipyard and notice the ship that had just tried to kill you is docked and already being repaired. "Well fought! I must say I did not expect you to survive."
계속...
"I am convinced of your strength and pledge to assist your cause. Let us patch up your hull, and provide you with some supplies."
A Rock station nearby is mass-broadcasting a request for medical aid. "Medical assistance required at Station R-0735Q. Need help extracting parasite. Will pay."
Offer to help.

The Rockmen are mildly confused that a Federation ship is offering to help, but don't complain. "We are representatives for Zulfiqar Industries. Yesterday, CMO Rig Bramston arranged a meeting on these premises with a Zoltan envoy named Tintan to discuss means of distribution and marketing within the Ministry. However, we did not anticipate a Slug vessel to arrive shortly after and deploy a 'prank' on the meeting, mind controlling Rig to consume Tintan whole. As you can understand, we are now in quite the dilemma and need to operate immediately."
Suggest they simply put them out of their collective misery.
"Your advice is worthless. We cannot simply assassinate both a high ranking Zoltan official and our own commander. We ask that you leave, and we will wait for a more helpful ship to arrive."
Offer to try and perform surgery.
"Do you have any training in operating of either of the two species? Or any species at all?" You shake your head. "Then get lost. We will wait for someone who knows what they are doing to arrive."
(Mind Control) Convince the two to live in symbiosis aboard your ship.

Even under the effects of the mind control, it takes a lot of convincing to get the two to agree with forever existing among one another. Their life forever changed, now remarkably for the better, they thank you, and even ask to join your crew. The Rock station is confused as to what has happened, but Rig seems certain this is the right option in his stupor and the Rockmen agree to let him go.
(Mantis Crew) Perform "surgery" on the Rockman.

Your Mantis, ever assured of its abilities, pushes past the Rockmen and marches into the room where the "infected" Rockman is being held. In a single swipe, it cuts straight through the stomach. The convulsing Zoltan falls out, quivering on the ground. The makeshift Rock medical team rushes in to fix the injured Rockman and physiologically evaluate the Zoltan. They aren't pleased with your solution, but they pay you as promised anyways.
(Tony Sr.) "Rig, is that you?"

"My god... Tony? Is that you? How are you here?" You have no idea what's going on, but Tony explains. "7 years ago, Tony's was nothing but a small chain local only to the Republic and quite small. I hoped to change that around by selling Zulfiqar goods. I met with Rig to discuss the terms, when out of nowhere a Slug ship arrived and mind controlled me into sticking myself up Rig's... uh... asshole. The surgeons had no idea how to handle the situation. For 3 years we lived like that, stuck together. I was forced to eat Rig's waste to survive. Eventually we found a professional capable of separating us, but it was too late to save either of us from the permanent trauma."
Uh...

The Rock station owners are completely baffled as to what is happening, but together you, Tony, Rig, and Tintan discuss the situation. It becomes clear Rig and Tintan won't be free of each other any time soon, but with Tony's help you might just be able to track down the Slugs responsible and get revenge.
We cannot help.
You ignore the Rock station and carry on your way.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

This beacon has landed you concerningly close to a densely populated Rock planet. You double-take when the ship computer informs you that this is no ordinary Rock planet, but rather Vrachos IV, the home planet of the Rock race.
계속...

The ship computer informs you on a few other details. Vrachos IV was largely abandoned because the massive industrial mining on the planet's surface led to a disastrous lack of necessary natural resources. This city, the capital of the Rock civilization, is one of the only few that remains populated. It is under strict control by one of the five Rock Elders, Stonewall. His incredibly uncreative name goes well in line with his uncreative methods of punishing dissidents, which usually involve torture and public executions.
계속...
The city below is bustling with activity, and far in the distance lays Stonewall's palace, blocking out the sunrise. It's not the biggest building here, but it commands the most attention.
Attack the palace.
You came to this reality to make a change and the Rock government is no better than the Rebels. As you approach the palace however, a gigantic Rock cruiser exits, ready to combat you.
계속...
We should leave.
A giant Rock city is no place for a Federation ship. You power up the thrusters and back away from the planet's surface.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.

No ship can outmatch you, not even a mighty Elite Rock Cruiser. Now defeated, the remains of the cruiser go down into flames, destroying the vast garden leading up to the Palace's entrance. It's plenty to scrap, but you don't have much time with the Rock soldiers running out to meet you.
계속...

Along with the Rockmen comes Stonewall himself, extremely irate at the damage you caused. "What have you done! You have proven your point, everywhere you go you only bring destruction and disrupt our ways of life! What is it that you want, why have you come here to ruin this day? Will simple money be enough to make you leave?"
Accept their pay.

Reluctantly, the Rock soldiers put down their guns and a hefty sum of scrap is brought out for you. This won't have much lasting effect on the Rock government other than an increase in security, but atleast this will help with your primary mission.
Use Stonewall as a hostage and bargain for an even greater reward.
We came here to make a change. Assassinate Stonewall now.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: You're far quicker than any of the guards, and in only a couple of seconds your blaster is held directly against Stonewall's head. It's a dangerous and nerve-racking exchange, but everything goes as 'planned' and a Rock transport delivers a large supply of goods.

It was a risky move, and things don't go nearly as 'planned'. The Rock guards are quicker than anticipated and one of your crew is shot in the chest. You still manage to grab Stonewall around his massive neck and hold a blaster to his moss-covered face. As your crew lies dying on the floor, a Rock transport is called in to deliver the larger amount of supplies. Once you're satisfied, you hurry back to the ship, making sure to keep your gun pointed at Stonewall the entire way back.
(Upg. Medbay) Provide medical assistance to your crew.
Luckily your crew is able to be treated in time. You pull away from the city, glad at the success of the mission.
There's nothing we can do to save our crew.
Your crew perishes in front of you, a casualty that could have been prevented if you simply hadn't tried something so daring.
Luckily your crew is cloned, relieving you of some of your guilt.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: You swiftly draw your blaster and blast Stonewall straight in the chest. The mighty titan of a creature falls to the ground in a thud, and the Rock soldiers are sent into chaos. You rush back to the ship but are stopped by the surge of Rock citizens breaking down the palace gates. A large horde of onlookers, witnessing your brave execution of their long-time brutal dictator, have been pushed to revolt, and they are stampeding to take down the soldiers.
Stay and help fight.

It's a violent fight, and there's heavy casualties on both sides, but with your trained military crew you help sway the tide in the civilians' favor. Once the battle is for certain over, the civilians thank you for your help. Most march on to take control of Stonewall's palace, but one Rock, a Crusader who turned on his masters, stays behind. "You have done us a considerable service, and I cannot let this go without thanks. Our kind may finally be free from this oppression, and this could very well be the start. I want to stay behind and keep fighting, but I also know a Federation ship passing through here with such a powerful loadout has a very important mission awaiting them, and they can use all of the manpower they can get."
Leave now.

Hopefully this newfound spark of hope you've started among the Rock people won't be smothered by the reinforcements the other Elders are bound to send. You can't risk your mission any further, so you power up the engines and fly away from the city.
낡은 탄광촌이 인근 행성을 공전하고 있습니다. 원래는 행성의 고리로부터 자원을 채취하기 위해 신정이 설립한 것이었으나, 현재는 몇 안 되는 락맨들과 그보다도 적은 수의 SSLG 요원이 모인 망명자 캠프로 바뀐 것 같습니다.
탄광촌에 방문한다.
아무도 당신이 정박하는 것을 신경 쓰지 않는 것으로 보아 그들은 분명 방문객을 맞는 것에 익숙할 것입니다. 대기실에 들어가보니 작고 운치 있는 불이 피워져 있었고 주민들은 로브 차림의 키 큰 락맨 주위에 둘러 앉아 있었습니다. 그 락맨은 노란색 페인트가 칠해진 창을 들고 있었는데, 이야기를 시작하려는 것 같습니다.
주민들과 어울린다.
로브 차림의 망명자가 활짝 웃으며 당신을 쳐다봤습니다. "존객 여러분, 우리와 함께하지 않겠소! 때마침 공포의 해적 투코의 이야기를 하려던 참이었소! 이곳 출신은 아닌 것 같은데, 어떤 이야기를 들어보고 싶소?" 그는 몇 가지 선택지를 제안했습니다.
투코의 첫 번째 이야기, 바크로스 4계의 항전.
투코의 두 번째 이야기, 킷팍 노예 수용소.
투코의 세 번째 이야기, 그의 유산.
전 투코가 누군지 잘 모릅니다.

"아하, 그러시군. 투코는 전설이자 영웅이오. 그것도 수많은 사람들의 영웅이지. 그것은 명예와 행적으로부터 물려받는 칭호요. 우리 망명자들은 역사 속에서 언제나 정의의 편에 섰던 여러 투코들에게 존경을 표하지. 그들은 적이 오래 전 몰락한 락맨-크리스탈 제국이든 현대의 신정이든 용맹하게 맞서 싸웠소. 이제 이 사실을 아셨으니, 내 이야기 중 하나를 들어보겠소?"
투코의 첫 번째 이야기, 바크로스 4계의 항전.
투코의 두 번째 이야기, 킷팍 노예 수용소.
투코의 세 번째 이야기, 그의 유산.
[연방 데이터베이스] 데이터베이스에서 투코에 대해 찾아본다.

The Dread Pirate Tuco, true to what the Outcast claims, is not so much a singular person but rather a title. The original Tuco for which the moniker was derived lived during the days of the archaic Rock-Crystal Empire and fought against Toarde and the other 4 Rock Elders during the collapse of the Empire. While Tuco's side inevitably lost and the Theocracy rose from the ashes of that war, stories of the ventures of Tuco continued to be shared by Rock school-children even after the Elders forbade them from being told. Several Rockmen have picked up the title of Tuco since then, giving the name even more infamy and immortality. The current holder of the title is believed to once have been known as Rowbad, and currently works as a bodyguard for Ocym, the Aquarian co-founder of the Argeonn smuggler clan.
투코의 첫 번째 이야기, 바크로스 4계의 항전.
투코의 두 번째 이야기, 킷팍 노예 수용소.
투코의 세 번째 이야기, 그의 유산.
이야기를 들을 시간이 없습니다.
"이거 아쉽게 됐구먼. 재미난 이야기라고 자신할 수 있는데 말이야. 그대가 내 이야기에 어울려 주지 않는다 해도, 선물은 받아줄 수 있겠지? 새로운 방문객은 환대하는 것이 우리의 관례라오."
이야기를 들을 시간이 없습니다.
"이거 아쉽게 됐구먼. 재미난 이야기라고 자신할 수 있는데 말이야. 그대가 내 이야기에 어울려 주지 않는다 해도, 선물은 받아줄 수 있겠지? 새로운 방문객은 환대하는 것이 우리의 관례라오."
이야기를 들을 시간이 없습니다.
"이거 아쉽게 됐구먼. 재미난 이야기라고 자신할 수 있는데 말이야. 그대가 내 이야기에 어울려 주지 않는다 해도, 선물은 받아줄 수 있겠지? 새로운 방문객은 환대하는 것이 우리의 관례라오."
주민들 사이에 끼어들어 보급을 부탁한다.
로브차림의 망명자가 정색하며 당신을 쳐다봤습니다. "당신은 이야기를 즐길만한 인물이 아니구먼. 연방 요원들은 언제나 딱 떨어지는 요점만을 말하지. 즐길 여유도 없는 여정에 도대체 무슨 의미가 있는 거요? 실례를 저지르고 싶진 않으니 당신의 부탁을 거절하진 않을거요. 하지만 보급이 끝나면, 우리가 평화로운 밤을 보낼 수 있도록 즉시 떠나주시오."
그들에게 관여하지 않는다.
이 사람들은 즐거운 시간을 보내고 있는 것 같습니다. 괜히 방해하지 말도록 합시다.
(스크랩 회수 로봇 팔) 탄광촌은 무시하고 직접 소행성을 채굴한다.
탄광촌을 무시한다.
탄광촌에 방문한다고 별다른 일이 벌어지진 않을 것입니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.

"잘 생각하셨소." 당신이 자리에 앉는 동안 그 망명자는 군중을 향해 팔을 뻗은 후, 자신의 이야기를 시작했습니다. "얼마 전, 그러니까 혁명이 일어나기 직전에, 시위자들은 락맨의 고향이자 신정의 수도 행성인 브라코스 제 4계에 모여들고 있었소! 시작은 평화로웠지만, 스톤월(현 장로이자 이단 심문관의 지도자)은 누구도 감히 자신이나 다른 장로들을 의심하지 못하게 하려 했고, 성전사들을 보내 군중을 처리하려 했소."
계속...

"그 중에는 신정이 자유를 짓밟는 것을 보고만 있을 수 없었던 불타는 영혼, 오늘날 우리가 투코라 부르는 젋은 망명자도 계셨소! 곧 싸움은 너무 크게 번진 나머지 누마 제 5계의 성기사들까지 불러들여야 했소. 장로들이 힘을 과시하는, 보기 힘든 순간이었다오. 체포된 동지들이 너무 많아 모두 처형할 수는 없음이 자명했기에, 시위의 주동자들만이 죽임을 당하고 다른 이들은 추방당했소. 갈 곳 잃은 투코께서는 수천의 다른 망명자들과 함께 불모지로 떠나, 지금 우리가 살고 있는 최초의 망명자 정착지를 건설하셨다오."
계속...

"잘 생각하셨소." 당신이 자리에 앉는 동안 그 망명자는 군중을 향해 팔을 뻗은 후, 자신의 이야기를 시작했습니다. "티카카 노예상들이 우리 구역에 있는 이유가 신정이 우리 형제자매들을 납치해 정부 건설 현장에 끌고 가기 위함이라는 것은 공공연한 사실이오. 투코 또한 이러한 습격에 당해, 티카카 주둔지로 끌려간 수많은 피해자 중 한 명이셨소. 하지만 투코 당신께서는 족쇄와 수갑을 두려워하지 아니하셨고, 한밤중에 저항군을 일으켜 그들의 잔인한 지도자를 쓰러뜨릴 계획을 세우셨소. 그가 투코라는 이름을 쓰기 시작하신 것도, 반란에 참여한 자들의 신원을 감추기 위한 코드명으로 사용하셨던 것이 처음이었소."
계속...

"투코께서는 다른 탈옥수들과 함께 노예상 녀석들을 압도하시고, 헤파이스토스 사의 함선을 훔쳐 탈출하셨소. 투코라는 이름은 해적과 신정 시민들에게 공포의 상징이 되었소. 그는 불모지로 돌아와, 로스트선의 아리아드네 제독과 힘을 합쳐 다시 한 번 불모지의 티카카를 몰아내셨소. 투코께서는 우리 망명자들과 함께 있어 주시다가, 다시 한 번 저 별들 사이를 누비기 위해 모험을 떠나셨소!"
계속...

"잘 생각하셨소." 당신이 자리에 앉는 동안 그 망명자는 군중을 향해 팔을 뻗은 후, 자신의 이야기를 시작했습니다. "티카카 놈들로부터 불모지를 구해내신 투코께서는, 불모지에서 조금 더 지내시다가 모험이 부르는 소리를 들으셨소. 신정 내에서의 조용한 삶, 그리고 티티카 노예상의 냄새나는 감옥 속에서 몇 달 간 지낸 투코께서는 모험심이 다시 타오르는 것을 느끼셨소. 위대한 투코께서 살아 계시니, 우리는 두려워할 것이 없소! 소문에 따르면 당신은 알게온의 설립자, 오심의 호위를 맡았다고 하오! 절대 두려워 마시오, 형제자매들이여 - 투코께서는 아직 우리를 버리지 아니하셨으니. 그는 떠나기 전, 불모지가 다시금 위험에 빠졌을 때, 우리가 그 분을 부르기만 하면 돌아와 주실 것이라고 약조하셨소."
계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: 당신은 이야기에 푹 빠진 나머지, 시간이 지나는 것도 잊고 있었습니다. 이야기가 끝난 후, 당신은 유감스럽지만 이만 떠나야 한다고 설명했습니다. "당신이 맡은 임무의 중요성은 이해하고 있소, 그렇기에 이 이상 붙잡고 있진 않겠소. 그리고 오늘 이 자리에 함께 해 줘서 고맙다는 말을, 우리 망명자 전원을 대표해서 전하겠소. 이 구역에 방문자가 오는 것도 흔치 않은 일이지만, 그 중 우리 역사에 대한 이야기를 들으려는 자는 더더욱 적어서 말이오. 부디, 이 선물을 받아 주었으면 하오."

당신은 이야기에 푹 빠진 나머지, 시간이 지나는 것도 잊고 있었습니다. 이야기가 끝난 후, 당신은 유감스럽지만 이만 떠나야 한다고 설명했습니다. "당신이 맡은 임무의 중요성은 이해하고 있소, 그렇기에 이 이상 붙잡고 있진 않겠소. 그리고 오늘 이 자리에 함께 해 줘서 고맙다는 말을, 우리 망명자 전원을 대표해서 전하겠소. 이 구역에 방문자가 오는 것도 흔치 않은 일이지만, 그 중 우리 역사에 대한 이야기를 들으려는 자는 더더욱 적어서 말이오. 부디, 이 선물을 받아 주었으면 하오."

당신은 이야기에 푹 빠진 나머지, 시간이 빠르게 흘러가는 것도 잊고 있었습니다. 이야기가 끝난 후, 당신은 사과와 함께 떠나야 함을 설명했습니다. "당신의 임무의 중요성은 이해하고 있소, 그렇기에 이 이상 붙잡고 있진 않겠소. 하지만 오늘 이 자리에 함께 해 줘서 고맙다는 말을, 우리 망명자 전원을 대표해서 하겠소. 이 구역에 방문자가 오는 것도 흔치 않은 일이지만, 그 중 우리 역사에 대한 이야기를 들으려는 자는 더더욱 적어서 말이오. 부디, 이 선물을 받아 주었으면 하오."
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: 당신은 근처에 로스트선 전초 기지가 있는 것을 보고 놀랐지만, 곧 그것이 딱히 악의가 있는 것은 아님을 깨달았습니다. 몇몇 순찰선들이 전초 기지 주변을 돌며, 근처 선박들에게 선의 신병 모집 활동을 광고하는 방송을 하고 있었습니다.
모집 센터에 들어간다.
당신이 로스트선 정거장에 들어가자, 수많은 경비원들이 당신을 둘러쌌지만 곧 당신이 연방 소속이라는 것을 알고는 안심했습니다.
특공대를 고용한다.
(망명자 선원) 그들의 훈련 시설을 대여해 망명자 선원을 특공대로 훈련시킨다.
거래를 제안한다.
기지의 지휘관은 잠시 생각을 하는듯 했지만, 이내 당신의 제안에 동의했습니다.
(신정 선원) 로스트선을 비난한다.
화가 단단히 난 락맨은 통신 장비를 낚아채고, 로스트선과 그 일원들을 향해 난폭한 비난을 쏟아냈습니다. 정말 뻔한 결과지만... 그들은 이것을 좋게 받아들이지 않았습니다.
계속...
(특공대 선원) 보급품을 요청한다.
모집 센터는 지나가는 로스트선 우주선들을 위한 보급소의 역할도 겸하고 있는 듯 합니다. 당신은 선원의 도움으로 손쉽게 보안을 통과하고 보급품과 수리 서비스를 받을 수 있었습니다.
(아리아드네) 보급품을 요청한다.
모집 센터는 지나가는 로스트선 우주선들을 위한 보급소의 역할도 겸하고 있는 듯 합니다. 당신은 아리아드네의 도움으로 손쉽게 보안을 통과하고 보급품과 수리 서비스를 받을 수 있었습니다.
전초 기지와 교전한다.
이 폭력 사태에 대한 정당한 이유가 있을진 모르겠지만, 그런 생각은 나중으로 미룹시다. 지금은 살육의 시간입니다!
계속...
거주지를 무시한다.
당신은 이 거주지를 방문할 만한 특별한 이유가 없습니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
근처 위성에 방어막으로 둘러싸인, 작은 망명자들의 마을이 있었습니다. 그 방어막을 유지하는 데는 적잖은 양의 전력이 필요할 것이었고, 방어막 외에 다른 보호 수단은 딱히 보이지 않습니다.
착륙해서 지원을 요청한다.
마을 주민들은 기꺼이 당신에게 물자를 내어 주었습니다. 많은 양은 아니지만, 어쨌든 공짜 보급품을 얻었습니다.
마을을 공격하고 방어막의 동력원을 장악한다.
(고급 무기) 전탄 발사!
당신의 무기는 방어막을 뚫는 데 부족함이 없었고, 몇 발은 내부의 건물에 명중했습니다. 망명자들은 즉시 대피하기 시작했고, 당신은 마을에 착륙해 동력원을 확보하기 위한 충분한 시간을 벌 수 있었습니다.
동력원을 반응로에 설치한다.
동력원 덕분에 반응로의 출력이 상승했습니다!
동력원을 방어막 시스템에 설치한다.
동력원 덕분에 방어막의 최대 출력이 상승했습니다!
동력원을 분해해서 연료로 만든다.
업그레이드가 필요하지 않았던 당신은 그 동력원을 다음 몇 번의 도약을 위한 연료로 변환했습니다.
(에너지 방어막 우회장치 + 텔레포터) 방어막 안쪽으로 선원을 보낸다.
당신의 선원은 방어막을 뚫고 들어가 무기를 들었습니다. 당신은 주민들이 저항할 것이라고 예상했지만, 그들은 당신의 선원을 피하기에 바빴습니다. 당신은 마을 중심부를 급습하고 동력원을 확보했습니다.
동력원을 반응로에 설치한다.
동력원 덕분에 반응로의 출력이 상승했습니다!
동력원을 방어막 시스템에 설치한다.
동력원 덕분에 방어막의 최대 출력이 상승했습니다!
동력원을 분해해서 연료로 만든다.
업그레이드가 필요하지 않았던 당신은 그 동력원을 다음 몇 번의 도약을 위한 연료로 변환했습니다.
마을을 무시한다.
당신에겐 이 사람들을 불안하게 만들 필요가 없습니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: 마을을 향해 쏠 수 있는 건 전부 쏴 보았지만, 방어막은 당신이 예상했던 것보다 훨씬 튼튼했습니다. 이 공격으로 얻은 것이라곤 망명자들의 당황한 시선과 수치심밖에 없습니다.
당신의 공격으로 방어막이 꽤 긴 시간 동안 꺼지자, 망명자들은 공포에 빠져 당신에게 항복했습니다. 솔직히 그 방어막을 완전히 뚫을 자신은 없었기 때문에, 당신은 그들의 항복에 만족하기로 했습니다.
방어막이 강력했하긴 했지만, 다행히도 당신이 쏜 몇 발은 운 좋게 방어막을 뚫고 안쪽의 건물에 명중했습니다. 망명자들은 즉시 대피하기 시작했고, 당신은 마을에 착륙해 동력원을 확보하기 위한 충분한 시간을 벌 수 있었습니다.
동력원을 반응로에 설치한다.
동력원 덕분에 반응로의 출력이 상승했습니다!
동력원을 방어막 시스템에 설치한다.
동력원 덕분에 방어막의 최대 출력이 상승했습니다!
동력원을 분해해서 연료로 만든다.
업그레이드가 필요하지 않았던 당신은 그 동력원을 다음 몇 번의 도약을 위한 연료로 변환했습니다.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: 송신소 근처에 SSLG가 세운 방송국 지부가 있었습니다. 그 방송국은 새로 도착한 선박들에게 자신들에 대한 선전을 내보내고 있었습니다. "신정의 시대는 끝났소이다! 락맨 동무들이여, 성전을 버리고 우리 크리스탈의 품으로 오오! 위대한 락맨-크리스탈 제국이 부활하는 날이 머지 않았소! 로스트선도, 연방도 보여줄 수 없는 길로, 우리가 안내해 줄 것이오!"
교신을 보내 방송을 반군을 지연시키는 데 써 본다.
(크리스탈 선원) 지원을 부탁해 본다.
당신은 크리스탈의 고집스러운 성격을 어떻게든 꺾고 그들이 당신의 위치에 대한 거짓 정보를 주기적으로 방송하도록 설득하는 데 성공했습니다.
(해킹) 방송을 탈취한다.
당신은 방송국의 송신기를 해킹해, 신호를 당신의 함선에 대한 방송으로 덮어씌웠습니다. 물론 위치에 대해선 가짜 정보를 흘려 놓았습니다. 크리스탈들은 바로 이 상황을 눈치채고 아니꼬워하지만, 그들이 송신기를 고치는 동안 그 정보는 충분히 반군의 귀에 들어갈 것입니다.
계속...
(최고급 해킹) 방송을 탈취한다.
당신은 방송국의 시스템에 악성 바이러스를 유포했습니다. 이 바이러스는 주기적으로 방송국의 방송을 당신의 함선에 대한 거짓 정보로 바꿔놓을 것입니다. 크리스탈들이 이 바이러스를 눈치챌 때쯤이면 반군은 이미 이 정보를 확보한 후겠죠.
계속...
선전은 그 종류 불문 나쁜 것이다. 이 정거장을 철거한다.
신정이 비도덕적이라는 것은 사실이지만, 이런 명예훼손적인 거짓말은 망명자들 사이에서 연방에 대한 평판을 떨어뜨릴 뿐입니다. 당신은 이런 거짓말이 퍼지는 것을 두고만 볼 수 없습니다!
계속...
무시한다.
이 선전이 연방에게 불리한 비난을 하고 있을 진 몰라도, 최소한 망명자들에게 지금 당장 무기를 들어 당신과 싸우라고 하고 있지는 않습니다. SSLG와는 엮이지 않는 편이 더 좋을 것입니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: 당신은 크리스탈의 고집스러운 성격을 어떻게든 꺾고 그들이 당신의 위치에 대한 거짓 정보를 주기적으로 방송하도록 설득하는 데 성공했습니다.
크리스탈들은 당신의 제안을 듣고는 웃음을 터뜨렸습니다. "그건 당신들이 원하는 것이지, 우리가 원하는 것이 아니오. 우리는 반군이 여기서 빨리 나가기를 바라오. 반군이 그대를 찾는 데 시간을 많이 쓴다는 건 우리가 그만큼 반군을 더 오랫동안 상대해야 한다는 뜻인데, 우리에게 그럴 이유가 있겠소?"
그들에게 뇌물을 준다.
크리스탈은 스크랩을 보더니, 본능적으로 집어들었습니다. "하지만 이건 우리가 원하는 것이 맞군..."
그들의 답변을 받아들이고 떠난다.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: 노예상들에게 점령당한 작은 망명자 마을이 보입니다. 노예상들은 이미 락맨 수십 명을 묶어놨고, 도망치는 것처럼 보이는 망명자 무리를 쏘고 있습니다.
개입한다.

당신이 근처에 착륙해 그들에게 다가가자, 노예상들은 갑자기 무기를 버렸고 그들의 대장이 나와 당신에게 무릎을 꿇었습니다. "오오 위대한 연방의 함장이시여, 이 잔인한 짐승들로부터 저희를 구하러 오셨군요! 저들이 제 부하를 죽여서, 저들의 가족을 죽일 수밖에 없었답니다! 정당방위였다구요! 이 자들이 더 이상 아무도 못 죽이도록 여기 묶어 놨습니다! 그러니 부디 제발, 이 악마 같은 자들의 체포를 도와주시지 않으시렵니까?" 마을의 반대쪽에 있던 망명자들은 이 말을 듣곤 덜덜 떨고 있었습니다.
망명자들을 돕는다.
누가 봐도 당연히 거짓말입니다. 노예상들은 그들의 "완벽한 계획"이 실패한 걸 알아차리자 곧바로 총을 집어들고 전투를 준비했습니다.
계속...
노예상들을 돕는다.
그들이 거짓말을 하고 있는 건 뻔히 보였지만, 당신은 이 상황을 이용하기로 했습니다. 당신은 남아있는 망명자들과 싸울 준비를 합니다.
계속...
끼어들지 않는다.
당신은 망명자들과 티카카 사이에 끼어들어 힘을 낭비하지 않기로 했습니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
"감사를 표하오, 선장. 순간 당신이 진짜로 노예상 놈들 편을 들 줄 알았소. 그러지 않아 다행이오."
"봐요, 당신이 정의의 편에 설 줄 알았다니까요! 연방을 위하여! 연방 만세!" 그 노예상은 주변을 둘러보더니, 아무도 박수를 치지 않고 있다는 것을 깨닫곤 풀이 죽었습니다. "뭐 이러나저러나. 노예나 한 명 데려가시던가, 난 모르겠다."
당신은 이 송신소에 있는 함선을 보자마자 여기 온 것을 후회했습니다. 연합이 이 지역에 침투한 것 같습니다. 당신은 즉시 그 함선으로부터 교신을 받았습니다.
답변한다.

화면에 나타난 것은 그 선박의 선장인, 싸구려 실험복을 입은 슬러그였습니다. "짜, 이건 이례쩍인 일이찌만, 연방에 대한 일은 나쭝으로 미루짜구요. 쩌는 연구짜이짜... 과학짜입니다! 쩌는 여기써 함께 있는 망명짜들의 수와 그들의 비약쩍인 능력 쌍씅의 관계에 대해 연구하고 이씁니다. 보씨면 아씨겠찌만, 쩨 게을러빠진 썬원들은 도와쭐 쌩각을 안 해써 말인데, 당씬이 쩔 도와쭈씨면 쪼케씁니다. 쭈변의 망명자 거쭈찌에서 씨쩨 몇 구만 가쪄와 쭈쎄요. 물론 보쑤도 드리게씁니다. 공짜로 뭘 해 쭈는 씨대는 아니니까요."
수락한다.
연합 선박이 알려준 대로 가 보니, 함선 몇 척이 도킹된 작은 망명자 거주지가 있었습니다. 당신은 지체 없이 무기에 전력을 넣고 전투에 돌입했습니다. 나포를 노릴 필요는 없습니다 - 락맨의 튼튼한 몸은 폭발 한 번 쯤은 견딜 수 있을 테니까요.
계속...
거절한다.
"맙쏘싸, 당씬네들 같은 탐욕스러운 짜씩들이 돈을 거부한다굽쑈? 쎄쌍이 어떻게 되려는 건찌 쩡말... 뭐, 쩡 그러씨다면 이쩨 쭉어 쭈쎠야게씁니다."
계속...
(인간 선원) "백지장도 맞들면 낫다고 하지 않습니까."
"어어어, 방금 그게 도대쩨 무쓴 말이찌요? 인간들의 유찌한 관용구 같은 건 이해할 쑤가 없다니까요. 그 말이 대쩨 뭐랑 무쓴 관련이 있다는 거쬬?"
"망명자들의 힘은 협동에서 옵니다."
"뭐라구요? 협동? 그런 건 얘기만 들어봤찌, 아찍 유쩐짜 단계에써 씩별한 건 아닌데 말이쬬. 망명짜들 싸이에써만 유쩐되는 특찡 비씃한 건가요? 연구할 만한 가찌가 이써 보이네요. 큰 도움이 되어씁니다."
먼저 공격한다.
연합의 함정에 걸려들 수는 없습니다. 전투 준비!
계속...
망명자 선박이 접근했습니다. 그 선박의 선장은 밝은 노란색의 레오타드를 입고 손에는 하프를 들고 있었습니다. "멈추시오, 연방이여! 나는 왕조의 땅으로 고귀한 항해를 떠나, 최고의 시인들로부터 이야기를 들려주는 기술을 배웠소. 나의 영웅담을 듣지 아니하면, 그대들의 보잘것없는 머리를 으깨 버리리오!"
그의 이야기를 들어 본다.

록맨은 하프를 뜯으면서, 괴상한 억양으로 이야기를 시작했습니다. "나의 이야기는 어둠 속의 비명으로, 나의 어린 육체가 어머니의 자궁에서 나오는 것으로 시작하오. 내가 어찌나 울었는지! 어머니께선 어찌나 우셨는지! 우리는 모두 울었다오! 내 생각엔! 솔직히 말하면 잘 모르오, 난 그저 태어났을 뿐이니. 그냥 때려 맞추는 것이오. 내가 아는 바로는, 사람들은 보통 태어나고 나서는 운다고 하니까."
계속해서 듣는다.

그 망명자의 이야기는 시작도 괜찮은 편은 아니었지만, 갈수록 더 나빠지기만 했습니다. 그는 자신의 소년기, 청년기, 성년기의 경험들을 계속해서 들려줬습니다. 그는 전 여친들에 대해, 멍청한 동업자들에 대해 불평했고, 교회의 석상 하나를 먹어치우는 이상한 이야기, 오키드를 만나고 나서 채식주의자가 된 이야기, 분리주의자 엔지와의 관계, 그리고 다른 이상한 이야기들을 늘어놓고 있었습니다. 당신이 장담하건대, 대부분은 뻥일 것이었습니다.
거의 끝난 것 같으니, 마저 듣는다.

락맨 시인의 이야기는 곧 현재 시점에 다다라, 그의 아이들의 이야기로 이어졌습니다. 당신의 선원 대부분은 곯아떨어졌지만, 당신만큼은 기적적으로 시인이 이야기를 끝낼 때까지 깨어 있었습니다. "즐거운 시간이었길 바라오! 빠른 시일 내로 책과 오디오북도 내리라! 마음에 들었다면 구독과 좋아요도 필수라오! 그 밖에 말할 건 딱히 없소!" 잠깐의 어색한 침묵 후, 망명자는 '감사의 표시'로 스크랩 조금과 무기 하나를 전송하며, 당신의 친구들에게 자신을 홍보해 달라는 말도 덧붙였습니다.
말을 끊고 떠난다.
더 이상 이 괴짜 녀석의 인생 이야기를 듣느라 시간을 허비할 수는 없었습니다. 당신은 싸워서라도 빠져나가기로 결정했습니다.
계속...
말을 끊고 떠나려 해 본다.
더 이상 이 괴짜 녀석의 인생 이야기를 듣느라 시간을 허비할 수는 없었습니다. 당신은 싸워서라도 빠져나가기로 결정했습니다.
계속...
이야기가 길어질 것 같으니, 대신 공격을 주고받는다.
이 괴짜 녀석의 인생 이야기를 듣느라 시간을 허비할 수는 없었습니다. 당신은 싸워서라도 빠져나가기로 결정했습니다.
계속...
전광판을 띄운 전함 주변으로 여러 척의 함선이 모여 있었습니다. "살아있는 바위, 유일무이한 충 붕갈룽을 보러 오시오!" 여러 척의 함선 사이에서, 충이 신정의 손아귀로부터 불가능해 보이는 탈출 계획을 성공시킨 것에 대한 흥분된 대화가 오갔습니다.
입장료를 낸다.
입장료를 내야 하는 것은 썩 내키지는 않았지만, 그래도 나름 싼 값이었습니다. 안쪽에는 목이 사라질 정도로 비만인 락맨의 초상화 여럿과, 기념품으로 판매 중인 모조 탄피 세트를 볼 수 있었습니다. 손님 접대용으로 개조된 대인 드론이 당신을 맞이했습니다. "살아있는 바위, 충 붕갈룽의 저택에 어서 오세요!"
드론을 따라간다.
드론은 당신을 새로운 방으로 안내했고, 그 방에는 다름 아닌 충 붕갈룽 본인이 있었습니다. "배회자라니?! 여기서 연방군을 보게 될 줄은 몰랐건만. 반갑소! 내가 바로 살아있는 바위, 충 붕갈룽이라오!"
예, 소문은 들었습니다. 그런 별명은 대체 어떻게 얻으신 겁니까?

"뭐, 알지 모르겠지만, 신정에서 못생긴 것은 락맨 사제에 대한 공격으로 간주한다오. 하지만 난 상상 이상으로 못생겼지! 나는 사형 선고를 받았지만, 총알 몇 발로는 살아있는 바위, 충 붕갈룽을 막을 수 있을 리 없었소! 그들은 한두 발도 아닌, 다섯 발을 쏘았다오! 총알이 안 먹히자 그들은 포기하고 나를 여기다 내다 버렸소. 나는 망명자들 사이에서 살아있는 전설이 되었다오. 그리고, 당신이 나와의 결투에서 이긴다면, 내가 총알을 맞고도 살아남은 방법에 대한 비밀을 알려주겠소."
결투를 신청한다.
"하하, 바라던 바오. 전투 개시!"
계속...
됐습니다.
"실망스럽군! 뭐, 이해하오. 하지만 그대는 내 비밀을 절대 알 수 없을 거라오! 하하하!"
함선들을 무시한다.
아마 사기꾼들 혹은 관광객을 낚으려는 바가지 장사꾼들 같았습니다. 혹은 둘 다일수도...? 당신은 여기 들르지 않기로 했습니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
"그대가 이겼소, 축하하오! 약속대로 내 비밀을 알려주겠소!" 충은 무기의 전원을 껐습니다.
전투를 멈춘다.
충은 몸을 앞으로 기대고 당신의 귀에 속삭였습니다; "내 비밀은, 바로... 내 지방이라오."
당신의... 뭐요?
"하하하하! 내 지방 말이오! 그 멍청이들은 내 머리를 겹겹이 싼 지방을 뚫지 못한 것이었소. 자, 이것은 훌륭한 스포츠맨쉽을 보여준 것과, 처음으로 날 전투에서 꺾은 사람이 된 것에 대한 보상이라오!"
계속해서 싸운다.
"자, 잠깐- 왜 이러시오?!"
"아무래도 그대가 진 것 같군! 약속대로, 내 비밀은 알려줄 수 없소. 미안하오, 선장!"
근처에 작은 임시 티카카 노예수용소가 세워져 있었습니다. 그들이 당신에게 어떤 교신도 보내지 않는 것으로 보아, 노예를 거래하는 곳처럼 보이진 않았습니다.
수용소를 공격한다.
그들이 당신에게 노예들 팔든 말든, 당신이 할 행동은 하나뿐이었습니다. 노예제도는 비도덕적이고, 당신은 이 사람들을 풀어줄 것이었습니다.
계속...
(텔레포터) 선원을 보내 노예 몇 명을 풀어주려 해 본다.
(고급 텔레포터) 선원을 보내 노예 몇 명을 풀어주려 해 본다.
당신의 선원은 수용소에 잠입해 그곳의 노예 여러 명을 풀어 주는 데 성공했습니다. 노예들과 당신의 선원은 노예상들이 따라잡기 직전에 함선으로 귀환하고, 당신은 들키지 않은 채로 유유히 떠났습니다.
노예수용소를 무시한다.
노예상들은 굉장히 위험하고, 특히 그들의 '화물'을 건드리는 건 절대 용납하지 않는 것으로 유명했습니다. 당신은 그들의 공간을 침범하지 않기로 했습니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: 당신의 선원은 수용소에 잠입해 그곳의 노예 여러 명을 풀어 주는 데 성공했습니다.
계속...
그러나, 함선으로 복귀하는 과정에서 노예상들에게 꼬리를 밟혔습니다! 당신의 승무원은 사살당했지만, 노예들은 살아서 당신의 함선으로 탈출했습니다. 숭고한 희생이로군요.
다행히도 클론 배양실은 당신의 선원을 되살릴 수 있었고, 그 선원은 자유의 몸이 된 노예들의 환호성과 함께 환영받았습니다.
당신의 선원은 수용소에 잠입해 그곳의 노예 여러 명을 풀어 주는 데 성공했습니다. 그러나, 함선으로 복귀하는 과정에서 노예상들에게 꼬리를 밟혔습니다! 노예상들은 발포를 시작했고 노예 여러 명이 죽지만, 당신은 당신의 선원이 함선으로 살아 돌아올 때까지 노예상들을 떨어뜨려 놓는 데 성공했습니다.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: 계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/textLis: 장로에게 반기를 든 락맨에게는 망명자 해적이 되거나 미래가 없는 난민이 되는 정도의 선택지밖에 남지 않습니다. 지금 이 구역을 순찰하고 있는 함선 또한 그 선택을 해야 했고, 그들은 당신의 함선을 표적으로 삼기로 결정합니다!
락맨 망명자가 타고 있는 함선이 당신을 포착합니다. 당신은 그들이 본인들의 함선에 불만이 많을 것이라고 추측했습니다. 근거는 그들이 당신의 함선을 빼앗을 준비를 하고 있다는 점이었습니다.
망명자들은 락맨 정부의 난민들입니다. 그들은 살기 위해서 해적의 길로 들어섰고, 이제는 다른 함선을 털어서 겨우 먹고 사는 처지입니다. 그리고 지금, 그들은 당신의 함선을 털어서 오늘을 나려 하고 있습니다.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: 계속...
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/textLis: The SSLG's agents have little beef with the Federation, but they've always been suspicious that it might try to intervene with their movement. One overly cautious ship nearby spots you and isn't taking any chances!

You catch radio chatter on a nearby SSLG ship and an unseen outpost some distance away. "By the glory of Dianesh, it's so damn boring here. We're supposed to be overthrowing brutal dictators, not sitting on our asses singing kumbaya with a bunch of hippies! Er, hold on. Someone's watching me... oh what the hell, I'll just go kill them and say they were a spy. Finally something to do!"

"Hey, you! You aren't meant to be here! This sector is under occupation of the SSLG!" Last time you checked, the SSLG has as little authority here as you do, but looks like these guys are intent on beating you up. Get ready for combat!
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: Seems nowhere is safe from the influence of Tiiikaka, including this beacon. As you enter the asteroid field, you spot a slaver vessel on the prowl for Outcasts. However, they spot you at the same time and attack, not risking you blowing their cover!
계속...

Much like Rocks anywhere else in the galaxy, the Outcasts don't seem to show much regard to the threat of solar flares. You however, do, but the ship nearby spots your unusual movement and suspects you of foul play!
계속...

One of the Outcasts' signature ramshackle villages has been constructed aboard an old mining platform, abandoned after the diminished density of nearby asteroid fields. Seems they have a request for you.
Listen.

"Please, you must help us! The SSLG and Lost Suns are in a constant feud, and it is driving us mad! Now, they've come concerningly close to our village, and if a conflict breaks out we will be caught in the middle! Could you please defuse the tensions between them before it escalates? We'll pay you in advance - we trust you to do the right thing."
Accept.

You travel not too much further until you find a standoff between two vessels. Their captains are currently engaged in a furious shouting match, calling each other creative insults such as "Son of a faux stone" and "Sediment for brains". No kidding when they said it was heated.
Try and talk it out.
Attack the SSLG ship.
You open fire on the Crystals, and like cowards the Lost Sun ship jumps away. Disappointing, but at least you'll be able to reap the rewards from this fight.
계속...
Attack the Lost Sun ship.
You open fire on the Rockmen, and like cowards the SSLG ship jumps away. Disappointing, but at least you'll be able to reap the rewards from this fight.
계속...
(Mind Control) Convince them to calm down.

Only able to mind control one of the two, you choose the Crystals as they're known to be more stubborn. The sudden switch in the Crystal's tone confuses the Rockman, but he isn't going let up. Eventually you just give up and tell the two to cut it out and they seem to finally give up. Though the Outcasts paid you already, they're so impressed by you being able to end the conflict without any bloodshed they offer a second reward.
Refuse.
You apologize but explain you are not the right person for this.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/eventLi: Both the Crystal and the Rockman turn to you in confusion, and you try to explain your point to them. However, seems it's too late as the two have already mutually muted you and gone back to shouting. Seems this won't work.
Attack the SSLG ship.
You open fire on the Crystals, and like cowards the Lost Sun ship jumps away. Disappointing, but at least you'll be able to reap the rewards from this fight.
계속...
Attack the Lost Sun ship.
You open fire on the Rockmen, and like cowards the SSLG ship jumps away. Disappointing, but at least you'll be able to reap the rewards from this fight.
계속...
Give up.

You try and convince the two to stop their arguing. They won't listen, so you divert your efforts to convincing them to go elsewhere. This works, and though the Outcasts paid you already, they're so impressed by you being able to end the conflict without any bloodshed they offer a second reward.
data/events_rock.xml.append$/FTL/event[@: A group of Theocracy vessels have gathered together near the beacon. They're concerningly well armed and protected, but they barely pay any attention to your presence.
Hail and ask about the distress beacon.

A rather annoyed Rockman responds, seemingly not at all grateful for your quick response to their distress call. "We were tasked with transporting military supplies to a Theocracy outpost at the end of this sector, but an SSLG squadron raided our convoy. If you can assist us in recovering it, we will give you the leftover supplies."
Accept their request and inquire about coords.
The Rockman grunts and grants you access to the coords broadcast by a tracking chip on the stolen cargo.
Refuse.
"Fine, then stop bothering us." The Rockman hangs up.
Attack the convoy.
You've decided to engage the Rockmen.
계속...
Avoid the convoy.
You aren't sure who these Rocks are hoping to get help from, but it certainly isn't you.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
As you approach the beacon, the tracker chip's signal lets out a beep of confirmation and goes silent. This must be the right place; you can see a couple SSLG ships docked with a small green station.
Attack the station for the cargo.
You've decided to attack the SSLG to get the cargo! Prepare for battle.
계속...
(Adv. Weapons) Demand they surrender.
The Crystals are both terrified and furious. "Do you have any idea what you're doing? The Theocracy aren't your allies! They'll stab you in the back the first chance they get! Don't do this!"
Ignore them and demand they hand over the cargo.

With no other choice, the Crystals hand over the cargo and jump away. Not too long after the Theocracy convoy arrives and inspects the cargo. Satisfied, they transfer over a reward, but as you're leaving hostile boarders spring up on your ship! Seems the SSLG was right about you being stabbed in the back.
Propose setting a trap with the cargo.
The Crystals seem to think this proposition over, but eventually accept. They swap the valuable items inside for explosives.
계속...

They thank you one last time and offer a gift before jumping away. Moments later the Theocracy convoy arrives, but as soon as you hand over the cargo it explodes! It mortally wounds the leaders of the Crusaders and cripples their systems. With no other choice, the Theocracy flees.
계속...
Choose not to fight.
On a second thought, maybe helping the Theocracy isn't in your best interest. You turn the ship around and fly away.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
A strange, yellow colored Crystal vessel is flying nearby, clearly the origin of the distress call. Despite this, the ship is very well protected and in seemingly no duress.
Hail.

On your screen appears a lavishly dressed Crystal painted gold sitting aboard a jagged command chair chiseled out of citrine. "Ah, so someone has finally responded. You foreigners are quite... erm... nevermind. Salutations! I am Sir Ruwen Argote, standing Foreign Ambassador of the Great Crystalline Empire. I have been sent here by her majesty Empress Dianesh Kryel. Quite a mouthful of names, yes? I understand you foreigners just love to share your names with all that you meet. Strange, strange... oh, but please take no offense!"
None taken.

"Wonderful! If you wish you can just call me Ruwen. That is my name, after all. You foreigners do call each other by your first names, right? It gets so confusing with all these 'misters' and 'misses' and 'doctors' and what not."
Yeah...
I'm exceptionally offended.

"Ohoho! A fine joke! I... I think that is a joke. You can never really be quite sure with you aliens. OH. Oh my, I am sorry. I understand foreigners do not like it when we address you as... erm... the 'a-word'. My apologies. I've been so rather clumsy, but old habits die hard!"
Yeah...
Ignore the ship.
Clearly no one here was under serious distress, and so there's no point in sticking around.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

Ruwen glances at his forearm where an ornate digital watch sits upon his wrist and projects the time into the air. "Erm, yes, sorry. Ycathine's crypt knows, I've gotten carried away with my ramblings again. Where was I? Oh, yes. I have been sent here by Empress Dianesh on an important diplomatic mission to recover a sacred object! Very boring political stuff, you wouldn't care much about it. But what you might care about is a job offer! I am in need of an escort. As you can see, my ship is very poorly armed. I require a ship that is... hum, how to put it... ready to put the fecal matter back up the rectums of those who stand in its path? I think that is how you foreigners say it?"
Uhm, sure.

"Good, because I do like saying that one! I will use it more often. Anyways, you look like an expert fecal-matter-putter-upper. With a small downpayment now and larger reward upon arrival, I request you help deliver me and my crew to an arranged meeting with the Lost Sun Admiral. As long as it's not too much of a burden for you, that is!"
Accept.

"Truly wonderful! You foreigners are so kind! I wish my people acted in such manners, but we keep to ourselves so often I think many of us have forgotten what generosity even means. But that's besides the matter. I've sent the coordinates, just clear the path and we'll be right behind you! Try not to commit too many warcrimes in our presense, heh! But no really, please don't commit any warcrimes."
Decline.

"Oh, terribly disappointing. Never matter, I understand! You foreigners come and go, always busy busy! Well, I'll be here then, waiting I suppose. Idi Tukala! Erm, sorry. That's... that's goodbye in my native language. Apologies."
Location of Ruwen's Destination.
Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

You've arrived at the destination Ruwen provided you with. Moments later, the Crystal arrives, jubilant as ever. "We meet again! You have my thanks, captain! As promised, your reward. Now, if you don't mind, I must hurry to my meeting. Idi Tukala! Erm, sorry. That's... that's goodbye in my native language. Apologies."
Stay and watch the meeting from a distance covertly.

You watch as Ruwen approaches a strangely colored Rock vessel. Seems to be a Paladin, a very rare and dangerous segment of the Inquisition usually tasked with protecting important clergy members. Based on the conversation you're eavesdropping in on, Ruwen seems equally confused. "Oh erm... pardon me. I was expecting Admiral Ariadne's envoy to be here. I don't believe I had any business with the Theocracy today!"
계속...

The fully armored Rockman barely moves as he speaks to Ruwen, his voice bitter. "The traitors whom you were sent to negotiate with have been apprehended by the Theocracy. The Lost Suns are criminals, and it reflects poorly on your Empire when you come into Theocracy territory and begin to make talks of peace with enemies of the Elders. There shall be harsh consequences for these actions."
계속...

Ruwen gulps nervously, and shifts uncomfortably in his crystalline chair. "Hahah, surely you're joking! Yes, the Lost Suns are your enemies, but it is not as though the Empire is looking to draw arms against the Elders! We merely wish to settle this ongoing feud between the SSLG and Lost Sun forces for occupancies of the Badlands! That is all. No need for hostility."
계속...

The Rockman squints, his gaze focused firmly on Ruwen. "Do not lie to me. We have already interrogated the criminals for the reason of your meeting. You wish to assist them in their attack on Numa V - in return to gaining access to the waystone device that you wish to rob from us. These are acts of war. The Theocracy might be involved in many other conflicts at this moment, but do not think we will take kindly to such insults." Suddenly, weapons spring from the hull of the Rock ship! They're going to attack Ruwen!
Interfere.
You won't stand for this. You raise your weapons and engage the Paladin ship.
계속...
We can't risk getting involved.
It's cruel, but this was the Empire's blunder, not yours. You can't risk angering the Theocracy like this.
Accept the reward and leave.
Eventually Ruwen leaves your sight as he passes behind a distant moon.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
The Paladin vessel has been defeated. A substantial amount of scrap remains behind to take.
Hail Ruwen.

It seems Ruwen's substantial defenses protected him from any major damage during the fight. Still, he's quite shaken. "By the Empress, oh dear. Had it not been for you, I doubt I would still be standing here. It would be against tradition for me to not extend an even greater reward as thanks to you and the Federation. Though my initial diplomatic mission here has failed, perhaps we have achieved new ground instead!"
계속...

"Now, erm, it seems there's little point in keeping past pretenses so let me begin again. I needn't waste your time which much historical mumble, but in short the Empire has been so tolerant of the SSLG's more radical motions as the Empress sees great benefit in gaining access to Theocracy grounds. We seek access to the Waystone, the device originally used to seal our homeworlds away from the galaxy. At first, we hoped the Lost Suns might retrieve it for us in return for more dedicated support. But now it seems those plans have faltered. Now, I must go at it alone. It will be perilous, but I wonder if you might be up for the task?"
Agree to escort Ruwen to the Crystalline Origins.
"Most wonderful! Then, with haste we must go! There isn't a second to lose!"
계속...
Decline.
"Ah, no bother then. You've done quite enough. Now, hopefully for the final time, Idi Tukala! Best of luck with your journeys."
